SEARCH
Package com.github.utils.src.main

Class CollectionUtils

java.lang.Object
com.github.utils.src.main.CollectionUtils
public class CollectionUtils extends Object
Utility class providing helper methods for Java collections. Includes methods for safe access, transformation, filtering, and specialized collection operations.

    • getOrDefault

      public static <T> T getOrDefault(List<T> list, int index, T defaultValue)
      Safe way to get an element from a list by index
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the list
      Parameters:
      list - the list to get the element from
      index - the index of the element to get
      defaultValue - the default value to return if the element cannot be retrieved
      Returns:
      the element at the specified index, or the default value if the list is null, empty, or the index is out of bounds

    • getOrDefault

      public static <K, V> V getOrDefault(Map<K,V> map, K key, V defaultValue)
      Safe way to get a value from a map by key
      Type Parameters:
      K - the type of keys in the map
      V - the type of values in the map
      Parameters:
      map - the map to get the value from
      key - the key of the value to get
      defaultValue - the default value to return if the value cannot be retrieved
      Returns:
      the value for the specified key, or the default value if the map is null or does not contain the key

    • partition

      public static <T> List<List<T>> partition(Collection<T> collection, int chunkSize)
      Splits a collection into chunks of the specified size
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to split
      chunkSize - the maximum size of each chunk
      Returns:
      a list of lists, each containing at most chunkSize elements from the original collection
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if chunkSize is less than or equal to 0

    • merge

      public static <K, V> Map<K,V> merge(Map<K,V> map1, Map<K,V> map2)
      Returns a new map with entries from the two input maps combined In case of duplicate keys, the values from map2 will overwrite the values from map1
      Type Parameters:
      K - the type of keys in the maps
      V - the type of values in the maps
      Parameters:
      map1 - the first map
      map2 - the second map
      Returns:
      a new map containing all entries from both input maps

    • merge

      public static <K, V> Map<K,V> merge(Map<K,V> map1, Map<K,V> map2, BiFunction<? super V,? super V,? extends V> mergeFunction)
      Returns a new map with entries from the two input maps combined using the provided merge function In case of duplicate keys, the merge function is used to compute the merged value
      Type Parameters:
      K - the type of keys in the maps
      V - the type of values in the maps
      Parameters:
      map1 - the first map
      map2 - the second map
      mergeFunction - the function to resolve conflicts between values associated with the same key
      Returns:
      a new map containing all entries from both input maps, with conflicts resolved using the merge function

    • toMap

      public static <T, K, V> Map<K,V> toMap(Collection<T> collection, Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor, Function<? super T,? extends V> valueExtractor)
      Creates a new map by transforming a collection using the provided key and value extractors
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      K - the type of keys in the resulting map
      V - the type of values in the resulting map
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to transform
      keyExtractor - the function to extract keys from elements
      valueExtractor - the function to extract values from elements
      Returns:
      a new map with keys and values extracted from the collection elements

    • toMultimap

      public static <T, K, V> Map<K,List<V>> toMultimap(Collection<T> collection, Function<? super T,? extends K> keyExtractor, Function<? super T,? extends V> valueExtractor)
      Creates a new multimap (map from keys to collections of values) from a collection
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      K - the type of keys in the resulting map
      V - the type of values in the resulting collections
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to transform
      keyExtractor - the function to extract keys from elements
      valueExtractor - the function to extract values from elements
      Returns:
      a map from keys to lists of values

      Groups elements of a collection by a key extracted from each element
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      K - the type of keys used for grouping
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to group
      keyExtractor - the function to extract keys from elements
      Returns:
      a map from keys to lists of elements with that key

    • take

      public static <T> List<T> take(Collection<T> collection, int n)
      Returns a new list containing the first n elements of the input collection
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to get elements from
      n - the maximum number of elements to take
      Returns:
      a new list containing at most n elements from the beginning of the input collection
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

    • skip

      public static <T> List<T> skip(Collection<T> collection, int n)
      Returns a new list containing all but the first n elements of the input collection
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the collection
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to get elements from
      n - the number of elements to skip
      Returns:
      a new list containing elements from the input collection after skipping n elements
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if n is negative

    • zip

      public static <T, U> List<Map.Entry<T,U>> zip(Collection<T> collection1, Collection<U> collection2)
      Zips two collections into a single list of pairs
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of elements in the first collection
      U - the type of elements in the second collection
      Parameters:
      collection1 - the first collection
      collection2 - the second collection
      Returns:
      a new list of pairs where the first element of each pair comes from the first collection and the second element comes from the second collection
